review: I'm pretty disappointed in the Fire Stick, and relieved I bought it on sale and not full-price.It's complicated to navigate, because it tries very hard to keep you in the Amazon Prime world; it's tough to locate other apps, and the search isn't global which just SUCKS. I hate having to go to specific apps to search and find whatever show I was looking for. The remote app on Android phone is a great idea, but it's clunky to use in reality. Overall, I really am just disappointed cause I was so excited for this thing, and now I wished I'd gotten a Roku or even Chromecast.The biggest disappointment is that you can only "fling" (cast) content from a Fire device (Amazon phone or tablet) and only Amazon content, though apparently other apps will soon be able to be shared as well? Anyway, this is my first night using it, and it was such a disappointment compared to how it was marketed that I've already turned it off and actually just ordered a Chromecast. Perhaps, as they make improvements, this thing will live up to Amazon's hype, but for now, it's a much lesser version of other streaming options, UNLESS you exclusively watch Amazon Prime video and primarily use Amazon devices, then it's pretty cool.

review: Still haven't been able to watch anything on it. After 2 hours of trying, I was finally able to get it to accept my router password. It played the intro video, and I can see the main menu, but it won't let me download or access Netflix or anything else. When I click on a Prime movie or show it tells me that I can watch for free with a Prime membership (which I have) and it takes me to the trial membership screen. The device is pre installed with my Prime info, and it acknowledges me. I've done everything, and cannot keep an internet connection. I even moved my furniture so my tv would have a better signal to the router. Good signal, bad connection. Very disappointed, and I hope Amazon makes good of their poor product. My daughter has a generic streaming box that works much better. I waited a month and a half for this to arrive, and missed Black Friday deals on other streaming devices because I thought I was getting something of Amazon worthy quality. According to other reviews, it seems to be luck of the draw with these devices. I got a bad draw.
author: Loren Price

review: I have had a good experience so far.  I bought the stick as soon as it was offered.  I thought I would use it on a bedroom TV and take it with me when I travel.  It installed flawlessly and I am able to plug it in to a surge protector right behind the screen so that it is completely hidden from the front.  It comes registered to your Amazon Video account and I immediately installed Netflix and Hulu.  It doesn't have as many channels as the Roku 3 on my main TV, but frankly I didn't care because I have the most important ones.  I like the design and think it is perfect for the purpose.
author: La Jolla Library User

review: Just installed it tonight & it works great. A little disappointed that Showtime Anytime can't be accessed as my cable provider (Charter Communications) isn't listed yet. I can access Showtime Anytime via my computer & Android tablet app. Think it is because it is a newer device. Charter supports Roku & other mobile devices. Hopefully the cable provider list grows over time because that is one of the reasons I bought the device was the selection of supported apps.
